channel.title: Jagex, lick my monkey nuts
channel.description:
Dear Customer Support,
A while ago I was reported for offensive language. I told somebody "lmao" (which, might I add, is not cencored in-game). They asked "what's 'lmao' mean, and I told them, Laugh my ass off. I realise 'ass' is a bad word, but I believe millions of players say it. I would like to apologise to the player I was talking to, but feel that punishment is not fair.
~Darknite
Thank you for your appeal.
We are sorry to inform you that this appeal has been denied.
We have conclusive evidence that you were in control of the account at the time of the offence and for this reason this offence will remain on your account.
We suggest you take some time to remind yourself of the Rules of RuneScape before you start playing again!
RuneScape Customer Support
My appeal had nothing to do with not being in control of the account. Whoever is working at RS Customer Support, learn to read. A third grader could do a better job.

item.title: Jagex, lick my monkey nuts
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“IcyPimp, post:1, topic:25453”]Dear Customer Support,

A while ago I was reported for offensive language. I told somebody “lmao” (which, might I add, is not cencored in-game). They asked "what’s ‘lmao’ mean, and I told them, Laugh my ass off. I realise ‘ass’ is a bad word, but I believe millions of players say it. I would like to apologise to the player I was talking to, but feel that punishment is not fair.

~Darknite

Thank you for your appeal.

We are sorry to inform you that this appeal has been denied.

We have conclusive evidence that you were in control of the account at the time of the offence and for this reason this offence will remain on your account.

We suggest you take some time to remind yourself of the Rules of RuneScape before you start playing again!

RuneScape Customer Support

My appeal had nothing to do with not being in control of the account. Whoever is working at RS Customer Support, learn to read. A third grader could do a better job.[/quote]

Well, you need learn how to tell what’s automated and what’s not. A third grader could do a better job.

Now, back on topic. Jagex will, and probably do get millions of messages sent to them though the websites ‘pm’ system. These could be bug reports, in game report abuse reports and the members only query’s. If I recall, a little more than a month ago they said on the websites news that they recruited extra mods and managed to sort out all the reports ect. I think they just got another pc to automate the appeals ect. Now, what we have here is a classic case of this. It isn’t the best report, witch leads me into thinking it’s fake but nevertheless, it is an automated response. If I could get my mails back from a year ago, I could prove to you that Jagex staff DO read and DO reply to some, but you can thank millions of rs players that yours was automated.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Josh wrote:

Awhile back on RSCN some guy threatned to kill himself if his character wasnt unbanned, he uploaded images of him righting runescape on his arm in tomatoe sauce (giving the affect of blood). And appealed to the ban with links to the images and basically telling them it was over.

They unbanned him, then 6 others tried on there pures and it worked. Its worth a shot?

item.title: Jagex, lick my monkey nuts
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“IcyPimp, post:6, topic:25453”]You can only attempt an appeal once.[/quote] Well make 2 noob accounts, when you get them off tut island, make them say lmao multiple times, and make them report each other. When they get banned, send in appeals via the noob accounts. Do this until you find out how to get past the program. Problem solved.

~Blacker

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex, lick my monkey nuts
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“IcyPimp, post:4, topic:25453”]No, I did not. I chose something like ‘I believe the ban was a mistake’ or something.

Edit: I chose “I think Customer Support have made a mistake”.[/quote] You need to know how to get around the automated replying program. Just pick the right words and it will confirm your reply. I have not learned to do this, but obviously the the program makes different reply rules for different appeals. It’s not like Jagex is going to reject every appeal (although it seems like it) So just keep appealing and appealing and appealing, until you learn how to get around it.

~Blacker

Read full topic
